decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with key creatures such as Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, while using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Careful Study to accelerate this process. The deck aims to eventually cast Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis for minimal cost and utilize Altar of Dementia to mill the opponent out. Bridge from Below provides additional value when creatures are put into the graveyard, creating an overwhelming board presence. Cabal Therapy helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while Once Upon a Time helps find key pieces.

This deck focuses on generating mass amounts of mana through creatures like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel, then using that mana to play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth or Allosaurus Shepherd to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to help dig for key combo pieces, while also having disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck aims to win quickly through powerful combos and efficient use of mana acceleration.

The key concept of this deck is to use dredge cards to self-mill and fill the graveyard with creatures, activating abilities from cards like Bridge from Below to generate Zombie tokens. The deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Ashen Rider and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis using cards like Dread Return. Cabal Therapy is used for disruption while Faithless Looting and Careful Study help fill the graveyard even faster. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's combo potential and enable explosive plays.

This deck aims to quickly combo off by casting a series of spells that allow the pilot to mill their entire library, then win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The key concept is to use aggressive mana acceleration and free spells to power out combo pieces quickly and effectively while utilizing disruption to protect the combo. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed to overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to react, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively lower your own life total in order to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting your opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze. The deck focuses on early board presence and tempo advantage, using efficient removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to control the board. The deck also includes countermagic like Force of Will and Stubborn Denial to protect your threats and disrupt your opponent's key plays. The mana base is designed to support both the aggressive game plan and the disruption elements of the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to use Painter's Servant to change the color of all permanents on the battlefield to a single color, then use Grindstone to repeatedly mill cards from the opponent's library until they lose the game. This combo is supported by counterspells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect it, along with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. Additionally, Boros Battleshaper and Moraug, Fury of Akoum provide additional ways to control the board and pressure the opponent, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary resources to generate a high storm count and win the game with Tendrils of Agony. It utilizes cards like Infernal Tutor, Cabal Ritual, and Dark Ritual to generate mana, while also including disruption and card selection spells like Duress, Thoughtseize, Ponder, and Brainstorm to control the game and find key pieces. The deck also includes protection spells like Flusterstorm and Veil of Summer to protect its combo pieces. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.

This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa of Shadowed Boughs and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate additional value. Additionally, the deck has strong creature options such as Elvish Reclaimer and Brushfire Elemental for added pressure. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent through resource denial and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts, particularly colorless ones, to quickly ramp up mana and disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. It aims to generate card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, while also creating a board presence with creatures like Sai, Master Thopterist and Urza, Lord High Artificer. The deck capitalizes on artifact synergy and powerful artifact-based abilities to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through aggressive plays and strategic resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures and equipment to disrupt the opponent's game plan and build up a fast, aggressive board presence. It aims to control the opponent's resources, limit their options, and chip away at their life total steadily. By combining hatebears like Thalia and Spirit of the Labyrinth with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a consistent, resilient offense. It also utilizes land disruption with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up quickly using Cloudpost lands and mana rocks, allowing you to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells ahead of schedule. Karn, the Great Creator helps you tutor out key artifacts, while Ugin, the Ineffable and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional removal and card advantage. Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass disrupt your opponent's game plan, while All Is Dust clears the board. This deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with huge threats and powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl provides card advantage and board presence. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements with efficient fetch lands and snow-covered lands.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to play aggressively, using cards like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Mimic to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures with cards like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, allowing for explosive starts. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing threats, making it a versatile and powerful aggressive deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on using a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Oko, along with versatile creatures like Uro and Snapcaster Mage to control the game. It also includes a suite of powerful blue spells like Brainstorm and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, as well as efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes cards like Life from the Loam and Stifle to generate value and disrupt the opponent's mana base. The mana base is designed to support its three-color strategy while also providing access to key lands like Wasteland.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths combo by utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to search for key pieces. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and Pithing Needle to shut down key cards. Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal help accelerate the deck's mana production, while Vampire Hexmage serves as a backup plan to remove counters from Dark Depths. The inclusion of lands like Karakas and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth provide additional utility and synergy with the deck's strategy.

The deck is focused on controlling the game with a combination of powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with Snapcaster Mage for added value, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while generating card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Back to Basics and Counterbalance also allows for additional control over the game state. The deck is designed to answer threats efficiently, control the tempo of the game, and ultimately secure victory through incremental advantage.
